captions.text:
So in Fort Lauderdale there was four cops
who were fired over horribly racism texts

and video that they had put out there their
names are Alex Alvarez Jason Holding James

Well and Christopher Sousa they range in age
from 22 to 31 they're cops in Fort Lauderdale

I'm going to read you some of the stuff that
they did we've got a little bit more detail

than when we first covered this story but
mainly the video has come out now the video

they did that had the KKK hood in it etc.
in some ways it's a little worse than I anticipated

we already know the n-words were going to
be in there but the some of the pictures of

dogs attacking black people is unbelievable
so I'll get to that in a second but first

let me give you some context here we told
you about the terrible texts they had sent

before let me give you part of the New Times
Broward-Palm Beach here Sousa was found to

have texted Holdings that's the other cop
we are coming and drinking all your beer and

killing niggers Sousa later said he did it
to fit in on the force and that he regretted

using the terms he said his best friend since
third grade is black OK so hey I was just

trying to fit in by hating all the niggers
that's not really a good defense and second

of all that leads us to believe that the problem
might be a little larger than Fort Lauderdale

if that's what a young officer from the on
the job thinks he has to do to fit in if you

take him at face value second of all now you're
going to go tell that really good friend of

yours that that's what you call him behind
his back have you been telling him that all

along yeah I didn't think so right so then
we go to one of the other officers Wells texted

the niggers and nigger lover dismissively
and also razzed Alvarez by calling him a faggot

of course why not insult everybody on the
planet while you're at it he call some his

coworkers lazy fucks he was referring to the
African Americans of course and used the term

retarded brown so that one I'm not sure refers
to African Americans or Latinos it seems like

they're ready to insult everyone on the planet
including their coworkers their colleagues

who are also cops who happen to be black so
you know they like to say oh no you know it's

just a tough job out there and sometimes we
get attacked no no no it's not just about

the people that you're policing you don't
like any black people including black cops

who you call the n-word behind their back
so the fact that two of them happen to be

Latino doesn't excuse any of this it's such
an incredibly stupid argument to say no no

no they couldn�t have been racist against
black because their Latino just like George

Zimmerman that's insane and second of all
you're also calling Latino I think retarded

brown and other reporting as indicted that
they did use racial slurs against Latinos

as well and so the fact that two of them are
Latinos maybe gives them an excuse against

other Latinos I mean not against other Latinos
but at least in regards to themselves the

two white guys don't have any excuses they
are insulting everyone on the planet OK now

if you're thinking well look man these guys
you know the stupid Fox News excuse they listen

to rap music there's no indication of that
whatsoever that's where they got it from its

black people's fault they introduced that
language besides they're just being friend

and this is their way of talking behind the
scenes you can't OK alright I'll give you

one more text to see if you still think that
Jason Holding writes I had a wet dream that

you two found those nigger in the VW and gave
them the death penalty right there on the

spot does that sound like kidding ha ha among
friends you think the guys in the VW were

his friend did he know them since third grade
I don't think so now you're going to get the

full context when you see the video that Alvarez
put together in the form of like a movie trailer

and it depicts them as some in some weird
way like I guess they think they're the good

guys by attacking black people with dogs and
all the other things they are going to show

here they look like the bad guys in the movie
trailer but I guess they off on that here

watch for yourself they call themselves the
hoods of death and in case it was unclear

through all the n-words that were used in
that trailer they put a KKK hood in the video

so you knew where they were coming from they
compare themselves to the guys who ran slaves

in the movie Django Unchained and they have
all the pictures of black people being attacked

and brutalized and they view that as like
ha ha that's what we're going to do to them

and this isn't just theoretical it's not like
they worked in a white neighborhood or a Latino

neighborhood and they happen to hate blacks
no they policed a predominantly black neighborhood

this is what they were excited about doing
now luckily in this case they've already been

fired it's a good question as to whether one
of them Sousa who said that this is the culture

of that police department I was just trying
to fit it is it that's a good question maybe

somebody should investigate that and for all
the people who say oh what are black people

complaining about today there was an article
in the Washington Post saying liberals should

get over Ferguson already it's their Benghazi
you think this is fake this is what black

people have to deal with all the time I'm
sorry that you Washington Post columnists

don't have to deal with don't know anything
about it and the cops treat you perfectly

find but how could you not see that this is
the reality for a lot of African Americans

in the country you'd be crazy not to be frustrated
over it not to do protests over it of course

you should exercise your rights as an American
to make sure this stuff changes look at what

they've got to deal with this is not a onetime
thing we've now shown you case after case

where African Americans are kill when they're
unarmed when they haven't done anything when

they've toy guns no guns even when they're
naked and then we've shown you cases where

cops in L.A. shoot unarmed black guys and
then get rewarded millions of dollars for

doing that and now you've got this video and
these texts when is it going to get through

to you that maybe the African Americans have
a different perspective and in their perspective

these are the guys who are supposed to be
policing them and patrolling their neighborhoods

does it looks like community policing to you
no it looks like they view blacks in the country

as the enemy it's hard not to get frustrated
by that it's hard not to want changed when
you see this change real change

title: Racist Police Text Video Released (Warning: Disturbing Content)

comments.text: So an upgrade of A Birth Of A  Nation.﻿
comments.author: Seal Honors

comments.text:
Ferguson =/= this. Not by a long shot. Yes, get the fuck over Ferguson. It 
was rioting and overreaction predicated on a lie to cover up an 
unequivocally justified shooting. However, there is something seriously 
wrong with this. When I heard "cops fired over racist texts," I was 
withholding judgment, because it's become a trend to fire police officers 
based on slightly unsavory social media postings. But, yeah, this looks 
pretty bad.﻿

comments.text:
I know these subjects arent related, but bare with me.

I watched a documentary the other day on the Exotic Animal Trade in Ohio. 
It followed the story of an owner (irrelevant) and a officer in Dayton 
county who deals with these situations. 

Long story short, at one point he tells the story of taking down an 
attacking Cougar with a police baton. Yes, a police baton, not a gun. I 
immediately thought, what the hell are we doing? How can a short, normal 
build white dude from Ohio take down a full grown Cougar with a police 
baton, while cops out here "need" to shoot unarmed Humans? 

If that in itself doesnt show you we are doing something wrong here, you 
are part of the problem.

(Great Documentary by the way, found it on Netflix)﻿

comments.author: Robin Addis-Vaughn

comments.text:
+ali Servan Yes, we do. We hear so much about racism throughout the force, 
then the Ferguson stuff, etc. and young adults or teens get their 
information from YouTube. They see these awful clips and begin to make 
presumptions (profiling, if you will, police officers) about ALL cops, the 
majority do kind generous things for others. There was a story not long 
ago, I'll try to find it, but a little boy was having his 6th year old 
birthday party, invitations sent,not one child showed up that was invited. 
Word started spreading throughout the neighborhood, neighbors came even if 
they didn't have kids, somehow the police department and fire department 
found out, a K-9 unit arrived and while those dogs can be vicious on 
command they are sweeties when they aren't. The fire department showed up, 
in one of their larger trucks! So the little boy got to sit in a cop car, 
play with a K-9, he got to sit in the fire truck, turn on the sirens. He 
had a good birthday after all. But, those bad cops are taking the focus 
away from good cops, so the general public is beginning to believe all cops 
are bad and it's not true!
comments.author: Robin Addis-Vaughn

comments.text:
+Robin Addis-Vaughn Exactly! We need to have a channel just for nice 
stories about cops.  The vast majority of police are decent. Just because 
the organisation is damaged it doesn't mean we should blame the officers. 
Just like illegal wars in Vietnam and Iraq, hate the war, not the soldiers.

got out, soon he along with other officers were hauling in bag after bag of 
groceries that people had bought for the family. Those are the good guys,

comments.author: GREENGMCENVOY03

comments.text:
So here is thought.  If you are one of the few idealist who join the police 
force because you want to protect and serve your community, and then when 
you get there, you are pressured into joining a group like the KKK which 
you dont agree with or else get punished by your department -- ie, freeway 
therapy or riding a desk, etc.   Then why would you not push to get 
transferred to another department that does not require you to pretend to 
be a hate activist? 

Chances are that your superiors would help push your transfer though, 
because they dont want you there if your not "one of them".  Thats the 
whole reason why they would give you shit assignments if you did not join 
their hate group...because they are trying to run you off.   After all, the 
less racist there are in a department, the less influence and power they 
have over it. 

Secondly -- "Because I like the neighborhood and I want to live there." is 
not valid excuse for not getting a transfer.  You may want to live there, 
but if your job forces you to pretend to be something you are not and go 
against your beliefs and ethics, then you are going to hate that job.  No 
mater how posh the department or the area you live is, its not going to be 
worth it to you if you have to be miserable every day. 

So I dont buy into this whole "boo hoo, woe is me.  I'm not a racist, I 
just pretend to be." bullshit.   If you a cop who gets busted for being on 
of the racists in a racist department, you had better have a stack of 
papers outlining a lot of retaliation against and a lot of transfer 
requests that have been denied by 'your' superiors.  Otherwise your a 
demonstrably full of shit and deserve every allegation you get.﻿

comments.text:
There is one thing bugging me here, Cenk said that the neighborhood was 
predominantly African-American; so how did these guys, with their sane 
minds, decide to engage in these kinds of racist conduct - even if it is 
between themselves- when they know that the community they have and want to 
protect is predominantly black. The only logical thing I can think of and 
this is only an opinion is that their racist behaviors or inclinations was 
there before they even got their jobs. So I just keep wondering about the 
criterias and the entrance examinations that people applying to this job 
have to go through. It seems to me to be very low standards of approval.﻿
